Package it.polimi.ingsw.santorini.controller.server

Class ClientConnectionSocket

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ClientConnectionSocket
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
Brief Server's socket communicating with a single client

    Brief Inner class responsible for the client notification when something in the server changes

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void analyzeClientMessage​(java.lang.Object message)
    Brief Analyzes a message received from the client connected to this socket, sending it back an answer
    private void checkSizeChangeRequest​(java.lang.String request)
    Brief Checks if the client requested to change the lobby's size, that is if the method completes its execution without throwing any exception
    private void checkStartRequest​(java.lang.String request)
    Brief Checks if the client requested to start the game and in that case asks the server if it's possible to start a new game, consequently forwarding the outcome to the client
    private void closeConnection​(boolean onKickedPlayer)
    Brief Closes all the active communicating channels with the client, then disconnects it
    private void createStreams()
    Brief Creates the streams to communicate with the client or closes the connection if something goes wrong
    private void handleMessage​(GameMessage message)
    Brief Handles a GameMessage verifying if it contains the player's chosen username.
    private void handleMessage​(TextMessage message)
    Brief Handles a TextMessage verifying if it contains a request for the change of the lobby's size
    private void handlePlayerUsername​(java.lang.String playerName)
    Brief Handles the registration of a player by trying to log him in the server and notifying him if his username has already been chosen
    private void logIn​(java.lang.String playerName)
    Brief Checks if a player can log in the lobby by analyzing the username he chose The convention followed for the ids is that they are progressive numbers starting from 1
    private void read()
    Brief Reads whatever the client sends, shutting down the connection if the client disconnects both with an explicit request and without sending anything
    void run()
    Brief Establishes a communication with the client, then interacts with it

    • ClientConnectionSocket

      public ClientConnectionSocket​(ServerNetworkHandler server, java.net.Socket clientSocket)
      Brief Creates the socket for the communication with client, then registers itself in the observers' list
      Parameters:
      server - is the server's instance
      clientSocket - is the socket that will interact with client

  • Method Details

    • closeConnection

      private void closeConnection​(boolean onKickedPlayer)
      Brief Closes all the active communicating channels with the client, then disconnects it
      Parameters:
      onKickedPlayer - is true if the disconnection takes place during the kick of a player

    • logIn

      private void logIn​(java.lang.String playerName) throws NameAlreadyTakenException
      Brief Checks if a player can log in the lobby by analyzing the username he chose The convention followed for the ids is that they are progressive numbers starting from 1
      Parameters:
      playerName - is the name of the logging-in player
      Throws:
      NameAlreadyTakenException - if there's another player in the lobby with the same name

    • handlePlayerUsername

      private void handlePlayerUsername​(java.lang.String playerName)
      Brief Handles the registration of a player by trying to log him in the server and notifying him if his username has already been chosen
      Parameters:
      playerName - is the username of the player who's trying to log in the lobby

    • checkSizeChangeRequest

      private void checkSizeChangeRequest​(java.lang.String request)
      Brief Checks if the client requested to change the lobby's size, that is if the method completes its execution without throwing any exception
      Parameters:
      request - is the textual format of client's request

    • checkStartRequest

      private void checkStartRequest​(java.lang.String request)
      Brief Checks if the client requested to start the game and in that case asks the server if it's possible to start a new game, consequently forwarding the outcome to the client
      Parameters:
      request - is the textual format of client's request

    • analyzeClientMessage

      private void analyzeClientMessage​(java.lang.Object message)
      Brief Analyzes a message received from the client connected to this socket, sending it back an answer
      Parameters:
      message - is the message sent by the client

    • handleMessage

      private void handleMessage​(GameMessage message)
      Brief Handles a GameMessage verifying if it contains the player's chosen username. If not, the method forwards the message to the MessageReceiver
      Parameters:
      message - is the message to analyze

    • handleMessage

      private void handleMessage​(TextMessage message)
      Brief Handles a TextMessage verifying if it contains a request for the change of the lobby's size
      Parameters:
      message - is the message to analyze

    • createStreams

      private void createStreams()
      Brief Creates the streams to communicate with the client or closes the connection if something goes wrong

    • read

      private void read()
      Brief Reads whatever the client sends, shutting down the connection if the client disconnects both with an explicit request and without sending anything

      Brief Establishes a communication with the client, then interacts with it
